etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Pigs: their Pedigree & Panegyric. From proverbial + -ize. Compare Middle French, French proverbialiser to make into a proverb, to use proverbially

definitions: To make into a proverb; to use proverbially; to speak of in a proverb. Also occasionally without object: to make or utter proverbs.
